biography: Ashok Kumar Mahapatra is an Indian neurosurgeon and academic, known for his contributions in neurosurgery and healthcare administration. He is Principal Advisor at Siksha 'O' Anusandhan, Bhubaneswar. He was conferred with the Padma Shri, India's fourth-highest civilian award, in 2024 for his service in the field of medicine.
aiSummary: A. K. Mahapatra is a pediatric neurosurgery specialist with an H-index of 110 at Neurosurgery (Faculty). Has been published in Journal of Clinical Neuroscience, Journal of Biosciences. Based in India.

As a pediatric neurosurgeon, Dr. Mahapatra's clinical expertise likely encompasses a wide range of surgical procedures and medical management strategies for conditions affecting the brain, spine, and peripheral nerves of children. Another area of significant clinical expertise would likely be the surgical management of congenital malformations of the brain and spine. He would also be experienced in treating craniosynostosis, a condition in which the bones of the skull fuse prematurely, restricting brain growth.

Pediatric brain tumors represent another significant aspect of Dr. Mahapatra's clinical expertise.
